page.title: 09FARM OWNERSHIP - WILLOUGHBY
page.content:
MOST OF THE FARM OWNERS HAVE HAD THE FARM PASSED DOWN TO THEM BY THEIR PARENTS. THEY HAVE ALL OWNED THE FARM FOR MORE THAN 25 YEARS AND THE AVERAGE SIZE OF THE FARMS IS ABOUT 100 ACRES APART FROM A COUPLE WHICH HAVE 160 ACRES. THE PRICE OF FARMS HAS ROUGHLY DOUBLED OVER A SPACE OF 10 YEARS. ONE OF THE FARMS LETS PEOPLE GO FISHING ON THEIR SMALL POND WHICH THEY OWN.
MOST OF THE FARMS IN WILLOUGHBY ARE UP A DISUSED TRACK WHICH RUNS TO GILMORTON. THIS USED TO BE THE OLD MARKET CATTLE TRACK YEARS AGO.
WILLOUGHBY FARMERS ARE VERY FRIENDLY AND HAVE A GOOD RELATIONSHIP WITH EACH OTHER.
